title: GlobalCoffeeDataset
description: This schema displays the initial basic Indicators for farm-level coffee sustainability, as originally determined by the GCP and the SPF Indicator Working Group. COSA--with feedback from the members of the Global Expert Committee--developed and synthesized practical metrics to operationalize the indicators so they can be functional across origins and comparable over time. The approach builds on global experience refined with tens of thousands of surveys and the expertise of the Committee members.

propertyNames.description: Property names must be in lower CamelCase

globalCoffeeDatasetId.description: The unique identifier for a dataset

schemaVersion.description: The version number of the schema. When not provided the latest version of the schema will be used to validate the dataset

farmerId.title: Globally Unique ID of the farmer
farmerId.description: Globally Unique ID of the recording of the farmer at a specific time and by a specific organisation.

name.title: First and last name(s) of the farmer surveyed
name.description: First and last name(s) of the farmer surveyed. Initials should be avoided when possible. In places where farmers use only one name (a family name), that name should be entered as the Last Name and an appropriate prefix or 'Farmer' could be entered as the First Name.

firstName.title: First name(s) of the farmer surveyed
firstName.description: First name(s) of the farmer surveyed. In places where farmers use only one name (a family name), that name should be entered as the Last Name and an appropriate prefix or 'Farmer' could be entered as the First Name.

lastName.title: Last name of the farmer surveyed
lastName.description: Last name of the farmer surveyed. Initials should be avoided when possible. In places where farmers use only one name (a family name), that name should be entered as the Last Name and an appropriate prefix or 'Farmer' could be entered as the First Name.

address.title: The location of the farm
address.description: Generally, data should include Country and then State/Department and Municipality/District, unless the address is collected for the sake of auditing. This should be the location of the farm itself (main plot), not the home of the farmer, if different.

dateOfBirth.title: Date of birth.
dateOfBirth.description: Data point used to understand the relative presence of youth and calculate youth engagement: % of producers in the sustainability program or supply chain 35 years old and under

gender.title: Gender
gender.description: Data point used to understand the relative presence of women and to calculate women's engagement and the outcomes they experience as diverse from men: % of women in the sustainability program or supply chain

farmIds.title: Farm Ids
farmIds.description: Which farms belong to this farmer. At least one is required.

thirdPartyIds.title: Third-party identifier
thirdPartyIds.description: When this dataset is reused by another organization who needs to use their own Global Unique Identifier, the original identifier can be saved here, to track history and origin.

povertyLevel.title: Poverty level
povertyLevel.description: Comparison of total household revenue to International (World Bank) Poverty Line (total divided by # adult individuals in hh)

householdMembers.title: Household members
householdMembers.description: Number of adults in the household

schoolAgeHouseholdMembers.title: School-age household members
schoolAgeHouseholdMembers.description: % of school-age household members, under age 18, who have completed appropriate grade level for their age

hazardousProhibition.title: Prohibition of children in hazardous working conditions
hazardousProhibition.description: Are young workers (those under age 18) working in hazardous conditions (applying chemical pesticides, using hazardous machinery, moving excessive weights/loads, etc.)

hunger.title: Hunger days
hunger.description: Number of days in past year that any member of household cut food consumption due to lack of food.

farmId.title: Farm Id
farmId.description: Globally Unique ID of the recording of the farm at a specific time and by a specific organisation.

farmerId.title: Farmer Id
farmerId.description: Globally Unique ID of the farmer of this farm

location.description: GPS should be captured for each farm plot if possible. GPS readings should be taken outside of buildings and away from significant tree coverage to avoid interference in the signal. GPS should be captured in the middle of the plot, and/or near the entrance to any main building (if there is one). Where the main residence or other buildings are not located on the farm plot, GPS should be taken in the middle of the plot.

positionTakenAt.title: The position was taken at ..
enum: Location of the front door of the head office

address.title: Farm address
address.description: This should be the location of the farm itself (main plot), not the home of the farmer, if different.

totalFarmSize.title: Total farm size (ha)
totalFarmSize.description: Total Farm size refers to total property size, including land used to grow crops, pasture, wooded areas, land covered by buildings, and any other area included in the property. Best practice is to collect response in any given unit, and then perform conversion to a standard international unit (ha).

totalAreaCoffee.title: Total Area planted in Coffee (ha)
totalAreaCoffee.description: Sum of coffee farm areas from producers in the sustainability program or supply chain (ha)

thirdPartyIds.title: Third-party identifier
thirdPartyIds.description: When this dataset is reused by another organization that needs to use their own Global Unique Identifier, the original identifier can be saved here, to track history and origin.

laborPractices.title: Labor Practices
laborPractices.description:
% of good labor practices adopted (of those listed). This indicator is applicable where farms rely on hired labor (not labor of household members).
# of good labor practices adopted / total number of practices

clearContracting.title: Clear contracting
clearContracting.description: Percentage clear contracting with workers to avoid any form of forced labor (including slave labor or child labor), which includes: the terms of the work, hours, duration, wages, payment details, deductions or fees, etc.

rightToOrganize.title: Right to organize
rightToOrganize.description: Percentage right to organize -- the ability for workers to join unions or committees and freely assemble

prohibitingDiscrimination.title: Prohibiting discrimination
prohibitingDiscrimination.description: Percentage prohibiting discrimination -- in terms of pay rates, hiring practices, housing for any group of workers (i.e., on the basis of immigration status, gender, ethnic or religious background, sexual orientation)

hazardousWorkingCondition.title: Hazardous working condition
hazardousWorkingCondition.description: Percentage hazardous working condition management--agrochemical protective gear; training on proper chemical handling, storage, and disposal; proper training and safeguarding for hazardous machinery, workplace sanitation, emergency preparedness, etc.

wages.title: Wages
wages.description: Daily average earnings for farm labor compared to (rural) minimum wage. Wage is listed and also expressed as a percentage of the rural minimum wage (where that exists), alternately to the national minimum wage.

wagesCoffee.title: The average daily wage rate paid for coffee production

wagesHarvesting.title: The average daily wage rate paid for harvesting

wagesProcessing.title: The average daily wage rate paid for processing

coffeeProfit.title: Coffee Profit
coffeeProfit.description: Total revenue from coffee sales minus total costs for coffee production (Reported in USD/ha of coffee productive area.)

productivity.title: Yield / Productivity
productivity.description: kgs of GBE (harvested)/ha of coffee productive area

coffeeProductiveArea.title: Coffee productive area
coffeeProductiveArea.description: Coffee productive area (requires local land area unit conversion to hectares)

amountHarvested.title: Amount harvested
amountHarvested.description: Amount harvested (requires local unit conversion to kgs)--Amount sold can be a suitable proxy where harvested amounts are unknown (i.e., many smallholders will only know production volumes when their product is weighed at the mill)

formOfCoffee.title: Form of coffee
formOfCoffee.description: Form of coffee (will require conversion to GBE, Green Bean Equivalent)

productionCosts.title: Cost of Production
productionCosts.description: Costs incurred to produce the coffee during the last production year (calculated per kg of GBE)

price.title: Average Price received per kg of coffee (GBE)
price.description: The simple approach involves asking for the total revenue received from coffee during the last production year as well as the amount sold (and the form). The average price per unit can then be calculated. For multiple sales, calculate the price average of sales

sustainablePurchases.title: Sustainable purchases
sustainablePurchases.description: Volume of sustainable purchases by buyer and as a proportion of total, and change year to year.

areaConvertedLand.title: Area converted land
areaConvertedLand.description: Land area (in ha) and proportion of the farm that was converted from natural land (e.g.,, forest, savanna) to land used for coffee production in the last 5 years.

ecosystemProtection.title: Forest and ecosystem protection
ecosystemProtection.description: % of forest and ecosystem protection practices used on the farm

fertilizerUse.title: Fertilizer use
fertilizerUse.description: Whether a professional assessment or advice was used to determine fertilizer needs on the farm. It does not require in-depth fertilizer information: nutrient amounts, local commercial names, dosage amounts, application rates, etc.

waterConservation.title: Water conservation practices
waterConservation.description: % of applicable water conservation practices used on the farm (of those listed)

waterContamination.title: Water contamination prevention practices
waterContamination.description: % of water contamination prevention practices used on the farm (of those listed).

noPesticideCleaningNearWater.title: No pesticide cleaning near water
noPesticideCleaningNearWater.description: Pesticide equipment is cleaned away from natural water bodies

preventUntreatedWater.title: Prevent untreated water
preventUntreatedWater.description: Ensuring untreated water from processing does not enter natural water bodies

noLivestockNearWater.title: No livestock near water
noLivestockNearWater.description: Grazing livestock away from natural water bodies

noDomesticDischarge.title: No domestic discharge
noDomesticDischarge.description: Domestic discharge prevented from entering natural water bodies

ipmPractices.title: % of IPM practices employed on the farm
ipmPractices.description: Focusing on IPM techniques is a globally standardized way to understand pest management best practices without the more costly and time-consuming process of detailing individual pesticides, active ingredients, amount used in local units, etc.

conductRegularVisualExaminations.title: Conduct regular visual examinations
conductRegularVisualExaminations.description: Conduct regular visual examinations of the coffee to detect pests and/or diseases

useNaturalPesticides.title: Use natural pesticides
useNaturalPesticides.description: Use traps, repellants, and natural pesticides

predatorPlaces.title: Predator places
predatorPlaces.description: Create or preserve places (including plant species) for beneficial predators of pests to live

recordPestInfestation.title: Record pest infestation
recordPestInfestation.description: Maintain written record of pest infestation, treatments, and results

pestRepelSpecies.title: Pest repel species
pestRepelSpecies.description: Plant or preserve species that repel pests of the coffee

applyAfterIdentifying.title: Apply after identifying
applyAfterIdentifying.description: Apply pesticide or kill pests only after identifying the pest and only at the best time in the pestâ€™s life cycle to permanently reduce its population

useOfBannedPesticides.title: Use of banned or hazardous pesticides on the farm
useOfBannedPesticides.description:
Banned or hazardous pesticides* will be based on the WHO Ia and Ib lists. COSA suggests that over time it will be useful to understand the types and/ or individual banned pesticides being used so that research bodies can develop varietals or take other actions that help prevent the need for their use in the field. This approach does not address proper disposal of pesticide containers. 
*Pesticides include insecticides, fungicides, rodenticides, nematicides, and herbicides.

soilConservation.title: Soil Conservation
soilConservation.description: % of applicable soil conservation practices used on the farm (of those listed)

contourPlanting.title: Contour planting
contourPlanting.description: Contour planting, terracing, or soil ridges around trees

liveFences.title: Live fences
liveFences.description: Live fences, hedgerows or buffer zones

recyclingOrganicMatter.title: Recycling organic matter
recyclingOrganicMatter.description: Recycling organic matter and crop waste

interplanting.title: Interplanting
interplanting.description: Interplanting, nitrogen fixing plants, cover crops, or mulching

checkDams.title: Check dams
checkDams.description: Check dams, drainage channels or diversion ditches

plotId.title: The unique ID of the plot
plotId.description: Globally Unique ID of the recording of the plot at a specific time and by a specific organisation.

farmId.title: To which farm belongs this plot

thirdPartyIds.title: Third-party identifier
thirdPartyIds.description: When this dataset is reused by another organization who needs to use their own Global Unique Identifier, the original identifier can be saved here, to track history and origin.

productivity.title: Productivity
productivity.description: Total revenue from coffee sales minus total costs for coffee production (Reported in USD/ha of coffee productive area.)

percentage.title: The percentage, 0-100
percentage.description: The percentage, from 0 to 100 with decimals allowed

positiveNumber.title: A positive number > 0
positiveNumber.description: A positive number starting at 0 with decimals allowed

greaterThanZero.title: The positive number, greater than 0
greaterThanZero.description: A positive number starting at greater than 0 with decimals allowed
